org.mellowtech.core.sort

Class Merge

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mellowtech.core.sort.Merge

  • public class Merge
extends Object
    Merge a set of sorted files into one large file. This Merge operates on ByteStorable objects.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Martin Svensson

    • Method Detail

      • setBlockSize

        public static void setBlockSize(int blockSize)
        Set the blocksize. How much data to read/write from disc. This number should seldom be no more than 4096.
        Parameters:
        blockSize - the size

      • merge

        public static <A,B extends BComparable<A,B>> void merge(String[] fNames,
                                                        B template,
                                                        ByteBuffer input,
                                                        ByteBuffer output,
                                                        WritableByteChannel outputChannel,
                                                        String dir,
                                                        boolean compressed)
                                                 throws Exception
        Merges a set of files into one large file. Merge will split the input buffer into chuncks of size blockSize, each corresponding to one input file. If the buffer is not large enough to hold a block for each input file the merge will be carried out in several steps (this to guarantee that sufficient data are read during every disc read).
        Type Parameters:
        A - Wrapped BComparable type
        B - BComparable type
        Parameters:
        fNames - the list of files to merge
        template - the type of objects to merge
        input - the input buffer
        output - the output buffer
        outputChannel - the channel to print the merged data
        dir - the dir where to find the input files
        compressed - true if the set of files are compressed using java.util.zip.DeflaterOutputStream.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • mergeDirect

        public static <A,B extends BComparable<A,B>> void mergeDirect(String[] fNames,
                                                              B template,
                                                              ByteBuffer input,
                                                              ByteBuffer output,
                                                              WritableByteChannel outputChannel,
                                                              String dir,
                                                              boolean compressed)
                                                       throws Exception
        Merges a set of files into one large file. This Merge does no conversion from the input bytes to objects. Merge will split the input buffer into chuncks of size blockSize, each corresponding to one input file. If the buffer is not large enough to hold a block for each input file the merge will be carried out in several steps (this to guarantee that sufficient data are read during every disc read).
        Type Parameters:
        A - Wrapped BComparable type
        B - BComparable type
        Parameters:
        fNames - the list of files to merge
        template - the type of objects to merge
        input - the input buffer
        output - the output buffer
        outputChannel - the channel to print the merged data
        dir - the dir where to find the input files
        compressed - true if the runs are compressed using java.util.zip.DeflaterOutputStream
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs
